How to Install sdf on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • sdf

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install sdf on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing sdf on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall sdf in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install sdf, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install sdf Using apt

To install sdf in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install sdf using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install sdf

The installation of sdf might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install sdf Using apt-get

To install sdf using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install sdf.

sudo apt-get -y install sdf

Install sdf Using Synaptic

To install sdf using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install sdf on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for sdf. This will display the sdf package in the package window, now to install sdf, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the sdf package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of sdf.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install sdf Using aptitude

To install sdf on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of sdf.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install sdf using the command aptitude install sdf.

sudo aptitude -y install sdf

How to Upgrade sdf on debian

If you want to upgrade the sdf package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade sdf using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade sdf to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade sdf.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade sdf sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade sdf

Upgrade sdf using Aptitude

To upgrade sdf using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade sdf.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade sdf

Upgrade sdf using Synaptic

To upgrade sdf using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for sdf, now right-click sdf, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade sdf just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall sdf on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall sdf from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just sdf, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove sdf

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of sdf

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of sdf you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge sdf

Remove sdf using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall sdf using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for sdf, right-click the sdf package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall sdf click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install sdf on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade sdf using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
